words.definition: An airway is a passage by which air reaches a person's lungs.
words.example: The doctor made sure the patient's airway was clear.

words.definition: The Almighty is a name for God.
words.example: He prayed to the Almighty for help in his time of need.

words.definition: The advent of something is the arrival or beginning of it.
words.example: The advent of the internet changed how we communicate.

words.definition: A constellation is a group of stars that forms a pattern.
words.example: The Big Dipper is a well-known constellation in the sky.

words.definition: If something is definitive, it is a final and complete answer.
words.example: The judge gave a definitive ruling on the case.

words.definition: To equate something means to consider it to be the same as something else.
words.example: You cannot equate money with happiness.

words.definition: To inhale means to breathe in.
words.example: He inhaled the fresh air of the forest.

words.definition: To invoke something means to call upon it for help or support.
words.example: The speaker invoked the memory of the great leader.

words.definition: If something is lunar, it relates to the moon.
words.example: The scientists studied the lunar surface from the spacecraft.

words.definition: A novelty is something that is new and unusual.
words.example: The new toy was a novelty for the children.

words.definition: If something is outmoded, it is no longer useful or popular.
words.example: The old typewriter is outmoded in the age of computers.

words.definition: To personalize something means to make it belong to a particular person.
words.example: She personalized her notebook by putting her name on it.

words.definition: To pertain to something means to relate to it or be a part of it.
words.example: This rule pertains to everyone in the classroom.

words.definition: If something is primal, it is very basic or important.
words.example: The need for food is a primal instinct for all animals.

words.definition: If something is psychiatric, it relates to the study of mental illness.
words.example: The hospital has a psychiatric department for patients.

words.definition: Psychiatry is the branch of medicine that deals with mental illness.
words.example: He decided to specialize in psychiatry after medical school.

words.definition: A reflex is an action that your body does automatically.
words.example: The doctor checked the boy's reflexes by tapping his knee.

words.definition: A seizure is a sudden attack of illness, especially in the brain.
words.example: The man had a seizure and was rushed to the hospital.

words.definition: A session is a meeting of a group of people.
words.example: The senate held a long session to discuss the new law.

words.definition: A utensil is a tool used in the house, especially in the kitchen.
words.example: Spoons and forks are common kitchen utensils.
